thread.title: Cubs put squeeze on Cardinals, even NLDS with 6-3 win
thread.title_full: Cubs put squeeze on Cardinals, even NLDS with 6-3 win

title: Cubs put squeeze on Cardinals, even NLDS with 6-3 win
text:
Updated: 8:49 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015 | Posted: 8:49 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015 Cubs put squeeze on Cardinals, even NLDS with 6-3 win Related View Larger Chicago Cubs starting pitcher Kyle Hendricks (28) walks off the field after being taken out during the fifth inning of Game 2 in baseball's National League Division Series against the St. Louis Cardinals, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015, in St. Louis. (AP Photo/Charles Rex Arbogast) View Larger St. Louis Cardinals' Randal Grichuk runs after hitting a solo home run off Chicago Cubs starting pitcher Kyle Hendricks (28) during the fifth inning of Game 2 in baseball's National League Division Series Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015, in St. Louis. (AP Photo/Jeff Roberson) View Larger Chicago Cubs' Austin Jackson, left, catches a ball hit by St. Louis Cardinals' Matt Holliday during the fourth inning of Game 2 in baseball's National League Division Series Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015, in St. Louis. Addison Russell is at right. (AP Photo/Charles Rex Arbogast) View Larger Chicago Cubs' Jorge Soler, right, celebrates with Kris Bryant after Soler hit a two-run home run during the second inning of Game 2 in baseball's National League Division Series against the St. Louis Cardinals, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015, in St. Louis. (AP Photo/Charles Rex Arbogast) View Larger Chicago Cubs' Jorge Soler, right, celebrates with Dexter Fowler (24) after Soler hit a two-run home run during the second inning of Game 2 in baseball's National League Division Series against the St. Louis Cardinals, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015, in St. Louis. (AP Photo/Jeff Roberson) View Larger Chicago Cubs' Jorge Soler, right, celebrates with teammates after hitting a two-run home run during the second inning of Game 2 in baseball's National League Division Series against the St. Louis Cardinals, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015, in St. Louis. (AP Photo/Charles Rex Arbogast) Chicago Cubs' Jorge Soler (68) watches his two-run home run during the second inning of Game 2 in baseball's National League Division Series against the St. Louis Cardinals, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015, in St. Louis. (AP Photo/Jeff Roberson) Sponsored Links The Associated Press ST. LOUIS â€” 
Kyle Hendricks and Addison Russell had successful squeeze bunts and Jorge Soler capped a five-run second with a two-run homer, and the Chicago Cubs held off the St. Louis Cardinals 6-3 on Saturday night to even their NL Division series at a game apiece. 
Manager Joe Maddon made all the right moves a night after the Cubs lost the opener 4-0. Now the series shifts to Wrigley Field for Game 3 Monday, where Chicago's 22-game winner Jake Arrieta faces St. Louis' Michael Wacha in the best-of-five series. 
The usually steady NL Central champion Cardinals made two errors as the Cubs didn't hit the ball out of the infield in scoring their first three runs in the second. 
Playing in his first postseason game, Soler connected off Jaime Garcia (0-1), who was lifted because of a stomach ailment after the second inning. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WPXI-TV Daily Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
